title: Public Storage Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics

content.text: As of the latest available data, the market capitalization of Public Storage is $41.84 billion.
Public Storage's valuation metrics can be assessed using various ratios.
Public Storage has a trailing twelve months (TTM) P/E ratio of 31.43, which indicates that the stock is priced at 31.43 times its earnings over the past year.
The TTM P/S ratio of Public Storage is 15.30, suggesting that investors are willing to pay 15.30 times the company's sales.
Public Storage has a P/B ratio of 9.54, indicating that the stock is trading at 9.54 times its book value.
To assess Public Storage's valuation in relation to the industry, it is important to compare these ratios to industry benchmarks.
The industry average P/E ratio is 22.50, while Public Storage's P/E ratio of 31.43 suggests that it may be relatively more expensive compared to industry peers.
The industry average P/S ratio is 10.20, indicating that Public Storage's ratio of 15.30 may be higher than the industry norm.
The industry average P/B ratio is 4.80, suggesting that Public Storage's P/B ratio of 9.54 is significantly higher than the industry benchmark.
